# Weekday Stickleback and Pipefish Feeding {#sec-husbandry-weekday_feeding}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: This procedure describes how to conduct weekday feedings for stickleback and pipefish
-   **Procedure Type**: Husbandry
-   **Species**:
    -   Threespine stickleback, (*Gasterosteus aculeatus*)
    -   Gulf pipefish (*Syngnathus scovelli*)
-   **Author**: Mark Currey
-   **Date Created**: March 08, 2024
-   **IACUC Protocol**: Covered under facility animal care procedures

::: {.callout-warning title="Notes"}
-   Fish are fed twice per day during weekdays
-   Feed fish at the start of the shift in the morning and at the end of the shift in the afternoons
-   Since fish are fed twice per day, only collect one half of the brine shrimp in the morning and make sure to reset the cone during the afternoon feeding
:::

## Materials

-   Adult stickleback food
-   Juvenile stickleback food
-   Brine shrimp
-   Squirt bottle
-   De-capsulated brine shrimp
-   Rock salt
-   105 Î¼m mesh shrimp collector
-   Baking soda
-   Frozen mysids
-   1000 ml beaker labeled "Pipefish Only"

## Solutions

-   None required

## Procedure

1.  **Conduct health checks** of all fish in Winter Room and Summer Room according to @sec-husbandry-fish_health_check.

2.  **Prepare brine cone** for feeding by following the steps described in @sec-husbandry-brine_gen_hatch_feed.

3.  **Feed Stickleback twice per day**

    a.  **Winter Room**
        -   20g tanks: Feed 1 scoop of adult stickleback food per feeding.

    b.  **Summer Room**
        -   20g tanks: Feed 1 scoop of adult stickleback food per feeding.
        -   4.5 and 10.5 liter tanks:
            -   **Larval** (2.8L and 9.5L tanks): feed small squirt of brine shrimp.
            -   **Juvenile** (9.5L tanks): feed half of a scoop of juvenile food.

::: {.callout-warning title="Notes"}
Please pay attention to the fish size in the 9.5L tanks and feed accordingly. Tanks of similar sized fish will try to be clustered together on the racks for ease of feeding. Also pay attention to signs and/or tags and messages on the white board or Teams for direction on how 9.5L tanks are to be fed.
:::

::: {.callout-warning title="Notes"}
If there is not sufficient adult or juvenile food to conduct feedings, see @sec-husbandry-dry_fish_food for instructions on making more food.
:::

4.  **Feed Pipefish twice per day**

    a.  **Summer Room - 20g tanks (adults and juveniles)**

        -   **Adults**: feed frozen mysids
            -   During the morning feeding please feed the adults only frozen mysids
            -   In the evenings please feed frozen mysids and live brine shrimp (see @sec-husbandry-mysid_culture for mysid culture)
        -   **Juveniles**: feed squirt of brine shrimp

::: {.callout-note title="Preparing and Feeding Frozen Mysids"}
Partially fill the 1000 ml beaker labeled "Pipefish Only" located on the pipefish rack with pipefish water. Place a dime sized piece of frozen mysids (bottom shelf in freezer) in the beaker with water, and swirl water to thaw mysids. Once thawed, feed to the adult pipefish.
:::

    b.  **10.5 liter tanks (mysids, pregnant males, and juvenile pipefish)**

        -   **Juvenile pipefish/mysids**: feed small squirt of brine shrimp

::: {.callout-warning title="Notes"}
Please move any male that has given birth into a community (20g) adult pipefish tank
:::
